BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President George Bush, the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Department of Defense to overturn the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Overturn the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell, Don't Pursue" policy and allow lesbians and gays to serve openly in the military.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger S.2735 and Assembly Member Lopez A.4523, “AN ACT to amend the local emergency housing rent control act, in relation to rent regulation law.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the local emergency housing rent control act, in relation to rent regulation law

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1363 and Assembly Member Abbate A.2577, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the police pension fund.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, loans to members of police pension fund

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S. 2178 and Assembly Member Abbate A.4362, “An Act to amend the penal law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving firearm license fee for certain retired officers, sheriffs, undersheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, waiving firearm license fee for certain NYC retired officers, sheriffs, underesheriffs and deputy sheriffs

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1955 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3869, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of correction in cities having a population of one million or more.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of dept. of correction in cities having a pop. of one million or more

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.2866 and Assembly Member Abbate A.6232, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the crediting of prior service by the police pension fund of such city.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to crediting prior service by the police pension fund

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Volker S.3118 and Assembly Member Abbate Jr. A.7020, “AN ACT to amend the General Municipal Law in relation to the payment of salary of certain peace officers.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the General Municipal Law, in relation to the payment of salary of certain peace officers

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Smith S.1816 and Assembly Member Cook A.2545, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Joseph Gray and Karl Gray, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 11993, Lot No. 39 on tax map for the borough of Queens.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclosure in Queens Block No.11993, Lot No.39 owners Joseph and Karl Gray

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Smith, S.2077 and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6940, “AN ACT to authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the New York City teachers’ retirement system for Rose Treiber.”
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the NYC teachers' retirement system for Rose Treiber.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Brewer and Moskowitz

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President George Bush, the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Department of Defense to overturn the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Overturn the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell, Don't Pursue" policy and allow lesbians and gays to serve openly in the military.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President George Bush, the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Department of Defense to overturn the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amended by Committee
Items.MatterName: Overturn the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell, Don't Pursue" policy and allow lesbians and gays to serve openly in the military.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President George Bush, the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Department of Defense to overturn the current “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Pursue” policy and allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Overturn the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell, Don't Pursue" policy and allow lesbians and gays to serve openly in the military.
